title: Archives, "Trude Guermonprez Archive"
medium: Press articles, brochures, correspondence, postcards, personal photographs, color slides, notebooks, textile' s photographs, textile's wood patterns.
provenance: This collection was donated to Cooper-Hewitt Museum in 1993 by Eric and Sylvia Elsesser.
creditline: Gift of Mr. Eric and Mrs. Sylvia Elsesser, The Trude Guermonprez Archives
description:
This archive includes interesting documents related to Trude Guermonprez's  life and work. The archives are specially related to the designer's work for her major clients, like Holland America Line and Owens Corning Fiberglass; other pieces in this archive are related to Guermonprez's work for the curtains made for major synagogues and her designs, interior fabrics, screens and  rugs realized  in conjunction with J.P.Oud, Architects associated, New York, Eric Mendelsohn, Warren Callister, etc.
The correspondence and the photographs in this collection allow us to know better the designer's private life.

tombstone.epitaph: Archives, "Trude Guermonprez Archive". Press articles, brochures, correspondence, postcards, personal photographs, color slides, notebooks, textile' s photographs, textile's wood patterns.. Gift of Mr. Eric and Mrs. Sylvia Elsesser, The Trude Guermonprez Archives. 1993-121-118.
